Video Control (Internal)¶

Warning

This section documents internal video control components. Students should not use these classes directly.

Camera Source¶

class src.video_control.camera_source.CameraSource[source]¶

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for all camera sources.

A CameraSource provides a unified interface for acquiring image frames from different camera backends (SDK-based cameras, OpenCV webcams, depth cameras, etc.).

All concrete camera implementations must implement:

  • initialize: start the camera and any background threads

  • get_frames: retrieve the latest available frame(s)

  • shutdown: safely stop the camera and release resources

This abstraction allows higher-level modules (e.g. VideoModule) to consume camera data without caring about the underlying hardware.

abstract get_frames() → Tuple[int, Any | None][source]¶

Retrieve the next frame(s) from the camera source. The amount of frames returned are implementation-dependent (e.g., single frame, color+depth pair, etc.).

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • An integer timestamp or frame index.

  • The frame data, which can be in any format depending on the implementation (e.g., NumPy array, OpenCV frame, etc.). Returns None if no frame is available.

Return type:

Tuple[int, Optional[Any]]

Notes

  • This method does not block.

  • Implementations typically return the latest frame stored in a buffer.

abstract initialize() → None[source]¶

Initialize the camera source.

This method should set up any resources required for capturing frames, such as opening camera devices, starting streams, or allocating buffers.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the camera cannot be initialized.

abstract shutdown() → None[source]¶

Shut down the camera source and release any resources.

This method should safely close camera devices, stop streams, and clean up allocated resources.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the camera cannot be properly shut down.

class src.video_control.camera_source.OpenCVCameraSource(camera_index: int = 0)[source]¶

Bases: CameraSource

Camera source backed by OpenCV’s VideoCapture.

This implementation is intended for:

  • USB webcams

  • Laptop cameras

  • Simple RGB camera setups

Frames are captured in a background thread and stored in a frame buffer.

get_frames() → Tuple[int, ndarray | None][source]¶

Retrieve the latest frame from the OpenCV camera source.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • (0, frame) if a frame is available

  • (-1, None) if no frame is available.

Return type:

Tuple[int, Optional[np.ndarray]]

initialize() → None[source]¶

Initialize the camera source.

This method should set up any resources required for capturing frames, such as opening camera devices, starting streams, or allocating buffers.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the camera cannot be initialized.

shutdown() → None[source]¶

Shut down the camera source and release any resources.

This method should safely close camera devices, stop streams, and clean up allocated resources.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the camera cannot be properly shut down.

class src.video_control.camera_source.RealSenseDepthCamera[source]¶

Bases: CameraSource

Intel RealSense RGB-D camera source.

This camera provides aligned color and depth frames using the RealSense SDK. Frames are captured asynchronously in a background thread.

get_frames returns a tuple (color, depth) where:

  • color is a BGR image (H, W, 3)

  • depth is a uint16 depth image (H, W)

get_frames() → Tuple[int, Tuple[ndarray, ndarray] | None][source]¶

Retrieve the latest aligned color and depth frames.

Returns:

(0, (color, depth)) if frames are available, otherwise (-1, None).

Return type:

Tuple[int, Optional[Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]]]

initialize() → None[source]¶

Initialize the camera source.

This method should set up any resources required for capturing frames, such as opening camera devices, starting streams, or allocating buffers.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the camera cannot be initialized.

shutdown() → None[source]¶

Shut down the camera source and release any resources.

This method should safely close camera devices, stop streams, and clean up allocated resources.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the camera cannot be properly shut down.

class src.video_control.camera_source.SDKCameraSource[source]¶

Bases: CameraSource

SDK-based camera source backed by Unitree’s VideoClient.

This implementation is intended for:

  • Unitree Go2 robot cameras

Frames are captured in a background thread and stored in a frame buffer.

get_frames() → Tuple[int, ndarray | None][source]¶

Retrieve the latest frame from the Unitree Go2’s internal camera source.

Returns:

(0, frame) if a frame is available (-1, None) if no frame is available.

Return type:

Tuple[int, Optional[np.ndarray]]

initialize() → None[source]¶

Initialize the camera source.

This method should set up any resources required for capturing frames, such as opening camera devices, starting streams, or allocating buffers.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the camera cannot be initialized.

shutdown() → None[source]¶

Shut down the camera source and release any resources.

This method should safely close camera devices, stop streams, and clean up allocated resources.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the camera cannot be properly shut down.

Frame Buffer¶

class src.video_control.frame_buffer.FrameBuffer(max_size: int = 10)[source]¶

Bases: object

Thread-safe fixed-size buffer for storing video frames.

This class wraps a queue.Queue to maintain a limited number of frames in memory. Older frames are dropped if the buffer is full. Designed for internal use by camera sources and streaming modules.

Parameters:

max_size (int, optional) – Maximum number of frames to store in the buffer (default is 10).

_queue¶

Internal queue storing NumPy ndarray frames.

Type:

queue.Queue

Streamer¶

class src.video_control.streamer.OpenCVStreamTrack(frame_queue)[source]¶

Bases: VideoStreamTrack

Video stream track that supplies frames from a local queue to WebRTC.

This class wraps a queue.Queue of frames and presents them as an aiortc.VideoStreamTrack. It is designed for internal use by WebRTCStreamer.

Parameters:

frame_queue (queue.Queue) – A thread-safe queue containing frames to stream.

async recv()[source]¶

Receive the next video frame for WebRTC.

Retrieves the latest frame from the internal queue. If no frame is available, the last frame is repeated.

Returns:

The video frame in BGR24 format, ready to be sent over WebRTC.

Return type:

av.VideoFrame

class src.video_control.streamer.WebRTCStreamer(host='0.0.0.0', port=8080)[source]¶

Bases: object

WebRTC streaming server for internal video broadcasting.

Handles serving a video stream over a local WebRTC connection. This class uses:

  • OpenCVStreamTrack to pull frames from a queue

  • aiortc for WebRTC communication

  • aiohttp for HTTP endpoints and offer/answer negotiation

  • Asyncio and a background thread for the event loop

Parameters:

  • host (str) – The hostname or IP to bind the server (default “0.0.0.0”).

  • port (int) – The TCP port for the server (default 8080).

_frame_queue¶

Queue for frames to send to WebRTC clients.

Type:

queue.Queue

_pcs¶

Set of active RTCPeerConnections.

Type:

set

_loop¶

Event loop for running the server in a background thread.

Type:

asyncio.AbstractEventLoop

async _offer(request)[source]¶

Handle incoming SDP offers from clients.

Parameters:

request (aiohttp.web.Request) – The HTTP POST request containing the SDP offer.

Returns:

JSON response containing the SDP answer.

Return type:

aiohttp.web.Response

async _run_server()[source]¶

Run the aiohttp + WebRTC server asynchronously.

Adds endpoints for “/offer” and “/” (HTML page) and keeps the server alive indefinitely.

async _serve_html(request)[source]¶

Serve the WebRTC demo HTML page to clients.

This page connects to the WebRTC server and displays video frames in the browser. For internal use only.

get_local_ip_address()[source]¶

Determine the local LAN IP address for client connections.

Returns:

Local IP address (e.g., 192.168.x.x), or “127.0.0.1” if detection fails.

Return type:

str

get_port()[source]¶

Get the TCP port used by the server.

Returns:

The port number.

Return type:

int

send(frame)[source]¶

Enqueue a video frame for streaming.

Parameters:

frame (numpy.ndarray) – The video frame to send. If the internal queue exceeds 5 frames, the oldest frames are discarded.

Notes

  • Non-blocking; frames are dropped if the queue is full.

shutdown()[source]¶

Shutdown all active connections and cleanup the server.

Notes

  • Closes all RTCPeerConnections.

  • Cleans up the aiohttp runner.

  • Should be called before program exit.

start_in_thread()[source]¶

Start the WebRTC server in a daemon thread.

Initializes a new asyncio event loop in a separate thread and runs the HTTP + WebRTC server asynchronously.
